raw_text:
Real in talks over Gravesen move
 
 Real Madrid are closing in on a £2m deal for Everton's Thomas Gravesen after the Dane's agent travelled to Spain to hold talks about a move.
 
 John Sivabaek told BBC Sport: "I'm here to listen to what Real have to say. Nothing has been agreed, but this is a big opportunity for any player." The 28-year-old's contract expires in the summer, but Real want a quick deal. Sivabaek added: "I will be meeting Real on Wednesday. There is serious interest, but it is Everton's hands." Everton must decide whether to cash in now on the Denmark midfield man, or risk losing him for nothing in the summer. Manager David Moyes has defiantly claimed that he expects Gravesen to still be at Everton when the transfer window closes at the end of January.
 
 Moyes said: "I speak to Tommy regularly and we know where we are at. "There's been no contact. We don't want to lose him." Real Madrid general manager Arrigo Sacchi is the driving force behind the move, convincing vice-president Emilio Butragueno and new coach Wanderley Luxemburgo that Gravesen is the right man for the Bernabeu. Everton must weigh up whether it is worth taking the money on offer for Real and risk their own ambitions for European football. Gravesen has been outstanding as Everton have established themselves in the Premiership's top four this season.
llama3.2:1b: Real Madrid are closing in on a deal to sign Thomas Gravesen from Everton with an £2m offer, according to his agent.
The 28-year-old midfielder is set to leave Everton when his contract expires in the summer unless Real can secure him early.
David Moyes claims he expects Gravesen to stay at Everton until January but wants to sell if possible to prioritize European football ambitions.

Real Madrid general manager Arrigo Sacchi is backing him after his performance in the Premiership this season has been exceptional.

The midfielder has impressed this season for the Toffees, and there has been speculation about a deal for him.

tinydolphin:1.1b: Real Madrid have close to a £2 million deal for Everton's Thomas Gravesen, according to reports from BBC Sport.
The Dane's agent, John Sivabaek, flew to Spain to hold discussions with Real over the transfer, and it appears as though the two parties are close to finalizing the agreement.
The 28-year-old midfielder has a contract that expires in the summer, but Real seeks a quick deal in order to secure his services.
Sivabaek added that there is serious interest from Everton in trading Gravesen for nothing, and he will meet with Real on Wednesday to finalize the deal.
Everton must decide whether to cash-in now or risk losing Gravesen for nothing when the transfer window closes at the end of January.

Manager David Moyes has expressed his belief that Gravesen is still an integral part of the team and will continue to be, stating that he expects the midfielder to still be at Goodison Park until the summer.
Real Madrid general manager Arrigo Sacchi and coach Wanderley Luxemburgo are pushing for the deal, convinced that Graveson's talent is invaluable to the club.
In the midst of this drama, Everton must weigh up their ambitions for European football and consider whether it is worth taking the cash to keep Gravesen at Goodison Park.
However, if they cannot match Real Madrid's offer, they may risk losing him altogether.
